title: 1920x1080 Resolution Issue
body:
For some reason, when I load up into a game of League with the resolution set to 1920x1080 (desktop resolution) the game looks like a zoomed in version of 600x800. The mouse cannot click anything without being far away from the actual icon, and player names are nowhere near their characters. The game was working fine last week, and I have made no changes to the computer or game settings. I have tried rebooting the game and reinstalling the game.  Going Fullscreen causes the character bar to take up the entire bottom of the screen, and looks like a resolution of 800x600.

I have uploaded screenshots of the issues

http://imgur.com/a/jujbX#5dQrRn3

replies.body:
This issue has been occurring pretty frequently for players running Windows 10 and a television display. More often than not,[ setting your Windows resolution](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/4910-screen-resolution-display-change-windows-10-a.html) to the recommended, along with matching your in-game resolution to that recommended resolution can resolve the issue. 

Should it persist, let me know what video card you have (Intel, Nvidia, AMD) and we can try additional steps. Let me know if you have any questions.

I'll try changing the resolution later today and will update at that time

Would a recent League update cause this?  I've only been on Windows 10 for about 2 months now, but this is the first time this issue has occurred for me.

Since Windows 10 updates automatically unless you configure it not to, it's extremely likely that you had some windows updates installed that caused the issues I listed above. I haven't seen a report that the update has solely caused this problem.
